Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Masterful Engagement.name: Masterful Engagement
Masterful Engagement.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae maintains the perfect distance between itself and its foe. It Steps and Strikes, in any order.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Taljjae (The General).name: Taljjae (The General)
Taljjae (The General).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

Carved scars mark the face of this severe mask, which gives Taljjae the skill at arms of a veteran commander.

Artificer's Command.name: Artificer's Command
Artificer's Command.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Ulistul directs one construct within 60 feet that can perceive her and has a level lower than hers, delivering helpful commands that improve its capabilities. The construct gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saving throws.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.FjcvJWPFwkyy5vEk]{Effect: Artificer's Command}

Statuesense.name: Statuesense
Statuesense.description: Ulistul built herself components granting her enhanced senses that can detect the location of other constructs and similar objects. She's aware of any constructs or inanimate statuary at the listed range.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Effects Creat.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Effects Created by Constructs

Artificer's Eye.name: Artificer's Eye
Artificer's Eye.description: Ulistul chooses one construct or statue she can currently perceive with a precise sense or with statuesense; usually, her only precise sense is vision. After choosing her target, she begins to perceive the target's surroundings as though she occupied its space. If the target is either an inanimate statue or a mindless creature, she can also verbally interact with nearby creatures (including issuing Artificer's Commands) or cause the target to move subtly, such as moving its mouth. This ability can be sustained indefinitely as long as Ulistul can perceive the target, though her visual stimuli from her own body are harder to process; she's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} when using her own senses for the effect's duration.

Dismantler.name: Dismantler
Dismantler.description: Ulistul's attacks against constructs and objects gain the deadly d12 trait and ignore up to 10 of the target's Hardness and resistances.

Ivory Dictum.name: Ivory Dictum
Ivory Dictum.description: Ulistul takes control of a construct within 30 feet. This has the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}(@Check[type:will|dc:32]) but can affect mindless creatures and ignores the target's golem antimagic, if any.

Ulistul.name: Ulistul
Ulistul.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. effects created by constructs

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Flexible Counterspell.name: Flexible Counterspell
Flexible Counterspell.description:
Trigger A creature Casts a Spell of the same or lower level as one of Taljjae's unexpended spell slots

Effect Taljjae expends any prepared spell of the same or higher level, losing a spell slot as if it had Cast the triggering Spell. Taljjae then attempts to counteract the spell with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 #Counteract]]{+27}.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Taljjae (The Hermit).name: Taljjae (The Hermit)
Taljjae (The Hermit).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

This wizened male face draws upon the powers of a true sage

Spectral Devil.name: Spectral Devil
Spectral Devil.allSaves: 对抗魔法时全豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法时全豁免+1状态加值

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: Destroying the Spectral Devil releases its pure, evil essence into the world, where it can find a new body and re-form. When the Spectral Devil is destroyed, its essence finds the remains of a dead horse and rebuilds its physical body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}. Only completing a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Dbd5W6G8U2vzWolN]{Consecrate} ritual heightened to at least 6th level, which consecrates the site of the Spectral Devil's destruction to a good deity, can prevent the Spectral Devil from returning and haunting the world once more.

Accursed Shriek.name: Accursed Shriek
Accursed Shriek.description:
The Spectral Devil unleashes a terrifying whinny in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]{30-foot cone} that deals @Damage[5d10[sonic]] damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29] save.

The Spectral Devil can't use Accursed Shriek for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Accursed Shriek]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} by the eerie noise.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, is frightened 2, and becomes cursed. The victim's mind echoes with the sound of the whinny, impairing concentration. The cursed creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} until the curse is removed.

Temteki.name: Temteki
Temteki.publicNotes: Though it superficially resembles a cypress tree and is easily mistaken for an arboreal or other similar plant creature, Temteki is actually an earth elemental, a creature of living earth and stone. In normal situations, Temteki is content to remain still and blend into the jungle when observing other creatures, using its natural camouflage to assist in harrying those it considers interlopers disturbing its home. Temteki usually dissuades such intruders with a combination of surprise attacks and nonlethal snares; the elemental is more interested in getting them to leave than in dealing them any permanent harm. However, to those who prove determined to harm Temteki or its home, Temteki can be an implacable foe. Temteki's asymmetrical gait and appearance often alarm and confuse creatures who aren't expecting to spot it, especially since it's surprisingly stealthy for its size and appearance.

Imposing Mien.name: Imposing Mien
Imposing Mien.description: Temteki can use Intimidation to Coerce or Demoralize up to four targets instead of one, rolling separate Intimidation checks against the Will DCs of each target. In addition, since Temteki Demoralizes using its appearance alone, it doesn't take a penalty to Intimidation checks to Demoralize for not speaking a language.

Interposing Earth.name: Interposing Earth
Interposing Earth.description:
Trigger Temteki is targeted with a melee or ranged attack from an attacker it can see

Effect Temteki raises earth to block, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: Temteki can Burrow through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnel or sign of its passing.

Earthen Cypress.name: Earthen Cypress
Earthen Cypress.description:
Requirements Temteki is standing on the ground

Effect Temteki draws up the earth around itself into the shape of a cypress tree. While in this stance, Temteki's reach for spike Strikes increases to 15 feet, but Temteki can't move except to Burrow into the ground using Earth Glide. Doing so causes Temteki to leave this stance and creates a heap of earth in the square Temteki left, making the square difficult terrain.

Toolbreaker.name: Toolbreaker
Toolbreaker.description: Temteki can only target worked or crafted items with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter}, not natural objects.

Spawn Of Kothogaz.name: Spawn Of Kothogaz
Spawn Of Kothogaz.publicNotes: Kothogaz's presence causes the land to sprout festering hives. Insectile, acid-drooling spawn slither from these growths as lesser versions of their creator.

Disharmonious Decay.name: Disharmonious Decay
Disharmonious Decay.description: When a spawn dies, its foulness seeps into the land in a @Template[type:burst|distance:100]{100-foot radius}. Non-magical plant life in the area decays within 1 hour, and new non-magical growth can't sprout for 1 month. A creature can act on the spawn's corpse within 1 minute of its death to limit this decay to a 10-foot square by succeeding at a @Check[type:medicine|dc:22|name:Prevent Spread of Decay (Medicine)], @Check[type:nature|dc:22|name:Prevent Spread of Decay (Nature)], or @Check[type:occultism|dc:22|name:Prevent Spread of Decay (Occultism)] check.

Fusing Spit.name: Fusing Spit
Fusing Spit.description: The spawn retches up thick, caustic sludge and spits it at a creature within 60 feet, causing equipment and flesh to melt and partially fuse together. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:23] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for 1 minute.

Taljjae (The Wanderer).name: Taljjae (The Wanderer)
Taljjae (The Wanderer).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

The slightly upturned smile of this mask depicts a sense of joy and wonder at travel and new experiences.

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Change Characters.name: Change Characters
Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Circling the Kingdom.name: Circling the Kingdom
Circling the Kingdom.description: Taljjae Strides twice and makes two quarterstaff Strikes at any point along its movement.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Taljjae deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} foes.

Waypoints.name: Waypoints
Waypoints.description: Taljjae leaves behind images of itself as it travels. Whenever it makes a Strike, it leaves behind a ghostly image of itself that lasts until the beginning of its next turn. These images block movement for Taljjae's enemies, and they provide flanking to Taljjae and its allies.

Taljjae (The Hero).name: Taljjae (The Hero)
Taljjae (The Hero).publicNotes:
The form of Taljjae's body can vary from visit to visit or even moment to moment, but it's easily recognized due to its signature cloak and masks. So long as Taljjae's mood is placid, it can be approached safely, but its mercurial temperament can be hard to predict.

The eyes of this female face seem to glint with determination.

Exit Stage.name: Exit Stage
Exit Stage.description:
Trigger Taljjae is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect Taljjae retains 1 Hit Point and teleports to an empty space within 30 feet. One of its masks remains behind and is broken.

Jelly Gluttony.name: Jelly Gluttony
Jelly Gluttony.description: If Taljjae detects buckwheat jelly with its jelly sense, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by the food and the creature possessing it (if applicable) and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to all other creatures for [[/br 1d4 #Rounds]]{1d4 rounds}, or until it uses an appropriate number of Interact actions to consume the jelly (generally 2: 1 to take the jelly, and another to eat it). If there's more than one helping of jelly, the condition ends once Taljjae consumes the jelly once.

Jelly Sense.name: Jelly Sense
Jelly Sense.description: Taljjae has scent as a precise sense out to 120 feet, but only to detect buckwheat jelly, the only food Taljjae loves more than flesh.

Change Characters.name: Change Characters
Change Characters.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Taljjae removes its current mask and dons a new one. The change refreshes Taljjae, restoring 25 Hit Points. Once Taljjae has removed a mask, it can't Change Characters back to that mask until it has worn all of its unbroken masks at least once, after which the cycle starts again. Taljjae can't don a broken mask.

When Taljjae Changes Characters, it gains access to the listed abilities. Any items (such as weapons) associated with its previous mask immediately disappear and are replaced by fresh ones for its new mask, but the effects of any mask abilities it has active persist. Removing a mask and later reapplying it doesn't restore any limited-use abilities.

Cometfall Arrow.name: Cometfall Arrow
Cometfall Arrow.description:
Taljjae fires an arrow that could shoot a star from the sky. All creatures in a @Template[type:line|distance:120] take @Damage[10d12[piercing]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true] save); on a critical failure, the target falls to the ground without taking falling damage, and it can't Fly, Leap, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground until the end of Taljjae's next turn.

Taljjae then can't use Cometfall Arrow for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Cometfall Arrow]]{1d4 rounds}.

Double Shot.name: Double Shot
Double Shot.description: Taljjae fires two shots, making two Strikes, each against a separate target and with a -2 penalty. Both attacks count toward its multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes both attacks.

Prop Master.name: Prop Master
Prop Master.description: Taljjae has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields from one of its masks.

Second Act.name: Second Act
Second Act.description:
Trigger Taljjae's turn begins Requirements Taljjae has 200 or fewer Hit Points

Effect Taljjae's dance reaches a frantic climax, allowing it to change personas rapidly. Taljjae Changes Characters.

Ulgrem-Axaan.name: Ulgrem-Axaan
Ulgrem-Axaan.allSaves: +2 status to all non-primal emotion effects

Frozen Contemplation.name: Frozen Contemplation
Frozen Contemplation.description: Being frozen stops the constant pain Ulgrem-Axaan has experienced since its death. Ulgrem-Axaan has fast healing 5 while in severe cold or colder environments, or for 1 round after taking cold damage.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Non-primal Em.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Non-primal Emotion Effects

Baleful Glare.name: Baleful Glare
Baleful Glare.description: 15 feet. Creatures entering or starting their turn in the emanation that can see Ulgrem-Axaan must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:22] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to baleful glare for 1 minute.

Territorial Rage.name: Territorial Rage
Territorial Rage.description:
Trigger A creature comes within melee reach of Ulgrem-Axaan while it's burrowed underground or underwater

Effect Ulgrem-Axaan lunges and makes a jaws Strike against the creature, which is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the attack and takes an additional [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} on a hit.

Unnatural Vengeance.name: Unnatural Vengeance
Unnatural Vengeance.description: Ulgrem-Axaan gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls against undead.

Voltaic Blow.name: Voltaic Blow
Voltaic Blow.description:
Requirements Ulgrem-Axaan has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its tail

Effect An electric shock passes through Ulgrem-Axaan's tail, dealing @Damage[(2d4+8)[electricity]] damage to the creature (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] save).

Bump in the River.name: Bump in the River
Bump in the River.description: An Ulgrem-Lurann can pretend to be a floating log while in water by attempting a Stealth check. It has a +2 circumstance bonus to its checks and DCs to do so. While using Stealth this way, creatures see the log but don't realize it's an Ulgrem-Lurann.

Nurtured Loathing.name: Nurtured Loathing
Nurtured Loathing.description: An Ulgrem-Lurann gains a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls against creatures with the undead trait.

Sparking Bite.name: Sparking Bite
Sparking Bite.description:
Requirements The Ulgrem-Lurann has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws

Effect Electricity courses through its body and mouth, dealing an additional @Damage[(1d4+6)[electricity]] damage to the grabbed target with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true] save.

Voltaic Blow.name: Voltaic Blow
Voltaic Blow.description:
Requirements The Ulgrem-Lurann has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws

Effect Electricity courses through its body and mouth, dealing an additional @Damage[(1d4+6)[electricity]] damage to the creature (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|basic:true|name:Sparking Bite] save).

Mosquito Witch.name: 蚊女巫 Mosquito Witch
Mosquito Witch.publicNotes: The Mosquito Witch is a humanoid figure with unpleasant, waxy skin. She always seems to have her head bowed and her shoulders hunched, a mane of unkempt black hair hiding all of her face save for a pair of unblinking red eyes and a long, sharp tongue that's as stiff and pointed as a proboscis. Fleshy, ribbed mosquito wings protrude from her back. She has six handless arms that taper into malformed points, which she keeps clutched to her chest like the legs of an insect's pupae. Her spindly legs also taper into points; when bloated from feeding, she must run on all eight limbs, which leave small holes in the ground as tracks.

Swarmsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: 集群感官 (模糊) 30 尺
Swarmsense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: 蚊女巫可以从附近的昆虫处不断接受信息。只要周围有昆虫引导她，她就可以使用触觉作为一种模糊感官，范围为所标注的距离。

Wild Empathy.name: 野性认同 Wild Empathy
Wild Empathy.description: 蚊女巫可以使用交涉技能对节肢动物（昆虫、蜘蛛和类似的无脊椎动物，例如蚊幅）进行@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{建立印象 Make an Impression}和提出请求。大部分节肢动物对蚊女巫的初始态度都是不关心。

Haunting Gaze.name: 慑人凝视 Haunting Gaze
Haunting Gaze.description: 30尺。当一个生物在灵光范围内结束回合时，必须进行@Check[type:will|dc:29]豁免。如果检定失败，则陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}若其已经陷入惊惧，则惊惧值上升1（最多@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 3}），并且在其下一回合结束时惊惧值不会下降1。如果在豁免失败之前该生物的惊惧值已为3或更高，则其@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{逃跑 Fleeing}1轮。

Dipteric Dread.name: 战栗双翼 Dipteric Dread
Dipteric Dread.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d6[piercing],2d6[poison]]{2d6穿刺和2d6毒素伤害} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[2d6[piercing],3d6[poison]]{2d6穿刺和3d6毒素伤害} (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[2d6[piercing],5d6[poison]]{2d6穿刺和5d6毒素}

Terror From Within.name: 内生恐惧 Terror From Within
Terror From Within.description: 蚊女巫的力量靠恐惧获得滋养。当一个生物因蚊女巫的噬咬和战栗双翼而受到流血或穿刺伤害时，还要受到2倍于其惊惧值的额外伤害。

Fafnheir.name: 法夫尼尔 Fafnheir
Fafnheir.publicNotes: 法夫尼尔是传说中的蛇龙之父。他比格拉利昂其他任何蛇龙都要更庞大，有着60尺的体长与超过10吨的重量。法夫尼尔是一个聪明而强大的生物，值得林诺姆诸王国所有人畏惧。
Fafnheir.allSaves: 对抗魔法时全豁免+1状态加值

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法时全豁免+1状态加值

Attack of Opportunity.name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity

Attack of Opportunity (Tail Only).name: 借机攻击 Attack of Opportunity (仅限尾扫)

Curse of the Woeful Wyrd.name: 哀灵诅咒 Curse of the Woeful Wyrd
Curse of the Woeful Wyrd.description: 当一个生物杀死了法夫尼尔，他就将成为后者灵魂的居所，并缓慢地脱离其击杀者的身体。该生物必须尝试一次@Check[type:will|dc:52]豁免，否则将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 2}（成功时为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}，大成功时不受影响）。生物除非在豁免骰上取得大成功，否则每天毁灭状态值增加1。如果该生物在承受哀灵诅咒时死亡，其尸体会爆炸，如同一次@Template[type:burst|distance:60]范围的爆裂龙息。法夫尼尔立即以满HP无状态复活至尸体相邻的可用空间中。即便是间接死亡也能允许法夫尼尔以两者之间的玄学联系诅咒其击杀者。

Enormous.name: 极巨型 Enormous
Enormous.description: 法夫尼尔占据6*6的方格（30尺*30尺），且有60尺长。

Extra Reactions.name: 额外反应 Extra Reactions
Extra Reactions.description: 法夫尼尔在其回合开始时获得两个反应动作。

Spit Boiling Blood.name: 飞溅沸血 Spit Boiling Blood
Spit Boiling Blood.description:
触发 一个60尺内的生物伤害了法夫尼尔

效果 法夫尼尔朝触发生物飞溅出沸腾的血液。该生物必须尝试一次强韧豁免对抗沸腾之血。

Blasting Breath.name: 爆裂龙息 Blasting Breath
Blasting Breath.description: 法夫尼尔呼出一道带有闪电与飓风之力的毁灭性火焰风暴，对@Template[type:cone|distance:90]范围造成@Damage[20d6[fire]]伤害（@Check[type:reflex|dc:48|basic:true]豁免）。此外法夫尼尔对爆裂龙息范围内的一个由法夫尼尔选择的生物造成额外@Damage[10d6[electricity]]伤害，遵循相同反射豁免结果。范围内生物还必须尝试一次@Check[type:fortitude|dc:48|name:Resist Winds|traits:damaging-effect]豁免来抵御龙息带来的强风和致聋的雷鸣。豁免失败的生物将受到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.g8QqHpv2CWDwmIm1]{造风术 Gust of Wind}效果，如常影响大型及以下体型的生物。最后，强韧豁免失败的生物将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{耳聋 Deafened}1分钟（大失败时将永久耳聋）。

Boiling Blood.name: 沸腾之血 Boiling Blood
Boiling Blood.description:
豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:48]

最大持续时间 10轮

阶段1 @Damage[6d8[fire]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 1} (1轮)

阶段2 @Damage[6d10[fire]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 2} (1轮)

阶段3 @Damage[6d12[fire]]伤害和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{流失 Drained 3} (1轮)

Furious Frenzy.name: 盛怒癫狂 Furious Frenzy
Furious Frenzy.description: 法夫尼尔以任意顺序进行两次爪抓打击与一次颚咬，角抵或尾扫打击。

Planar Tear.name: Planar Tear
Planar Tear.disable: DC 47 Lore (master) related to the specific plane beyond the rift to disrupt the planar frequency and close the rift, @Check[type:arcana|dc:52|name:Undo the Rift's Manifestation (Arcana)|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) or @Check[type:occultism|dc:52|name:Undo the Rift's Manifestation (Occultism)|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) to undo the magical manifestation of the rift, @Check[type:performance|dc:55|name:Counteract the Rift's Frequency|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) to play a tone that counteracts the rift's harmonic frequency, or @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:55|name:Plead With Ebeshra (Diplomacy)|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) or @Check[type:religion|dc:55|name:Plead With Ebeshra (Religion)|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] (legendary) to plead with Ebeshra to close the rift
Planar Tear.hazarddescription: Ebeshra opens a massive rift in the Material Plane that pulls nearby creatures into another plane entirely. The rift is typically to a random plane in the multiverse, though Ebeshra can have the rift pull creatures into a plane of Ebeshra's choosing. Additionally, Ebeshra can choose any number of creatures to be immune to the effects of the planar rift, usually due to the kaiju recognizing the innocence of the creatures.
Planar Tear.routine:
The rift pulls creatures within 500 feet toward it. The rift can pull any creature, regardless of its size. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:45|name:Planar Rift|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] or @Check[type:reflex|dc:45|name:Planar Rift|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] save (the creature's choice) to resist the effects of this pull or attempt to grab something to avoid getting pulled.

Critical Success The creature resists the pull and doesn't move toward the rift.

Success The creature is moved 25 feet toward the rift.

Failure The creature is moved 50 feet toward the rift.

Critical Failure The creature is moved 100 feet toward the rift. The harsh pull causes the creature to take @Damage[10d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

If a creature is directly beneath the rift when the rift pulls it, the creature instead attempts a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:50|name:Pull Into the Rift|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] or @Check[type:reflex|dc:50|name:Pull Into the Rift|traits:complex,conjuration,divine,environmental,kaiju,teleportation,hazard] save (the creature's choice) to avoid being pulled into the rift. On a failure, the creature is pulled up into the rift and thrown to a random point on the plane on the other side.
Planar Tear.reset: Ebeshra vanishes 1 minute after opening the rift, which closes the rift. Ebeshra must wait 1 week before it can open another planar rift.
Planar Tear.stealthdetails: (master) to notice Ebeshra twisting its shape in preparation of creating a planar rift

Tear Reality.name: Tear Reality
Tear Reality.description:
Trigger Ebeshra recognizes a nearby threat as needing an indisputable resolution, or a deity tasks Ebeshra with creating a planar rift

Effect Ebeshra twists its body, aligning its segmented sections into a fine blade, and cuts the fabric of the Material Plane. It creates an enormous rift in a point in the sky within 1 mile. The rift is 100 feet long and 50 feet wide. The hazard rolls initiative.

Kallas Devil.name: Kallas Devil
Kallas Devil.publicNotes: Bearing a resemblance to the flayed nuckelavee that lurks in stagnant swamps, the Kallas Devil distinguishes herself by being able to separate herself from her mount without issue, as well as with her powers of disguise and subtlety. Though her wicked trident and violent fury are enough to sear her image into the minds of the local people, it's the Kallas Devil's ability to slip unseen among her would-be victims that elevates the creature beyond the ranks of a common horror. No matter how careful the residents of Riverton are with their youth and the vulnerable, the Kallas Devil claims her chosen target more often than not, luring the hapless victim toward doom while wearing a smiling child's face.

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description: The Kallas Devil adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.RCbLd7dfquHnuvrZ]{False Vision}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XXqE1eY3w3z6xJCB]{Invisibility}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GP3wewkQXEPrLxYj]{Subconscious Suggestion} to her coven's spells.

Leatherwork.name: Leatherwork
Leatherwork.description: Once a month, the Kallas Devil can spend 1 day stitching the skin of a person into her coat. This gives her skinned cloak a +1 circumstance bonus to her AC for one week.

Loathsome Stench.name: Loathsome Stench
Loathsome Stench.description: 20 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that succeeds at its saves is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Mount Steed.name: Mount Steed
Mount Steed.description:
Trigger The Skinned Steed enters a space adjacent to the Kallas Devil

Effect The Kallas Devil mounts the horse.

Skinned Steed.name: Skinned Steed
Skinned Steed.description: The Kallas Devil has a horse minion known as the Skinned Steed. The horse has a swim speed equal to its standard Speed and the minion trait, and it's under the control of the Kallas Devil. The Kallas Devil automatically succeeds at all checks to Command the Skinned Steed. While mounted on the Skinned Steed, the Kallas Devil fuses with the horse, causing the two to become a single being. The Skinned Steed doesn't act on its own while fused with the Kallas Devil, instead acting as the Devil's legs to move around the battlefield. The Kallas Devil doesn't command the Skinned Steed in this state and instead replaces her Speeds with the mount's speeds until she dismounts. While the two are separated, the Kallas Devil needs to Command the Steed, as normal. If the Skinned Steed is killed, the Kallas Devil can replace it by spending 1 day to prepare another horse, converting it into her new Skinned Steed.

Call Steed.name: Call Steed
Call Steed.description:
Requirements The Skinned Steed hasn't been killed and is within 60 feet

Effect The Kallas Devil whistles loudly and calls for her steed, prompting the creature to Stride twice toward the Kallas Devil.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The Kallas Devil can take on the appearance of any Medium or Small female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Devil's Charge.name: Devil's Charge
Devil's Charge.description:
Requirements The Kallas Devil is mounted on the Skinned Steed

Effect The Kallas Devil Strides twice. If she ends her movement within melee reach of at least one creature, she can make a melee Strike against that creature.

Flay Alive.name: Flay Alive
Flay Alive.description:
Requirements The Kallas Devil has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, and it has been grabbed since her last turn.

Effect The Kallas Devil flays her prey, dealing @Damage[(2d12+17)[slashing]] damage, and the target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save. On a failure, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} on a critical failure). On a critical success, the creature escapes from being grabbed; otherwise, the Kallas Devil extends the grabbed condition until the end of her next turn.

Sewer Haze.name: Sewer Haze
Sewer Haze.description:
Many healers and alchemists suspect that sewer haze has a supernatural origin, given its association with particularly strong otyughs.

豁免检定 @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23|name:Sewer Hsaze]

Onset 2 days

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and stupefied 2 (1 day)

阶段3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} (1 day)
